main_definition: A system is a set of connected parts working together as a whole, often used to describe complex organizations or structures with interrelated components.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An organized group of objects or concepts related in such a way that they form a coherent whole
meanings_and_examples.example: The solar system consists of the sun and all the celestial bodies orbiting it.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A set of principles or procedures intended to achieve a particular result
meanings_and_examples.example: The company implemented a new system for managing customer relationships, resulting in increased efficiency and satisfaction.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A collection of elements that are related through some form of interconnectivity
meanings_and_examples.example: In computer science, an operating system is a complex system made up of various components such as hardware drivers, kernel, user interfaces, etc.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A group or network of people who work together to achieve common goals
meanings_and_examples.example: The healthcare system consists of doctors, nurses, hospitals, and other medical professionals working together to provide care for patients.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An interconnected set of machines or devices that function collectively
meanings_and_examples.example: In manufacturing, an assembly line system is used to produce goods efficiently by having different workers perform specific tasks in a sequence.
